title: 107_hr1229
content: The Act titled "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Smoking Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" covers counseling for tobacco cessation under the Medicare program. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Smoking Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" includes coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Smoking Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" provides coverage for counseling services for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program. Counseling services must be provided by a physician or other authorized healthcare professional and must be proven effective to be covered. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Smoking Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" eliminates cost-sharing for counseling services for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program, covering 100 percent of the actual charge or a fee schedule determined by the Secretary. The Act eliminates the deductible for counseling services for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program, effective January 1, 2002. The Act eliminates the deductible for counseling services for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program, effective January 1, 2002. SEC. 3. MEDICAID PROGRAM. The Act eliminates the deductible for counseling services for tobacco cessation in the Medicare program, effective January 1, 2002. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act to remove exceptions from Medicaid prescription drug coverage for smoking cessation medications and require coverage of smoking cessation counseling for pregnant women. Cost-sharing for smoking cessation counseling services for pregnant women is also removed. Amendments to the Social Security Act require coverage of counseling for tobacco cessation for pregnant women in Medicaid, effective January 1, 2002. Amendments to the Social Security Act now include smoking cessation counseling and medications as part of quality maternal and child health services. This amendment will take effect upon the enactment of the Act.
